title: Hookes law - block with friction and two springs

content.question: A block on a horizontal surface is attached to two horizontal springs, as shown. Both springs are compressed a distance <math alttext="delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math> from their unstretched length and the block remains at rest due to static friction between the block and the surface. Which of the following is a correct expression for the magnitude of the force of static friction?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, k sub 1, plus k sub 2, close parenthesis, and denominator 2, end fraction, times delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, k sub 1, plus k sub 2, close parenthesis, times delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="k sub 1, times k sub 2, times delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction k sub 1, over k sub 2, end fraction, times delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, k sub 1, plus k sub 2, close parenthesis, times delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
